indication/OpenRedmine,open,Send notifications,[],It would be very useful to have a notifications function where notifications are shown on a change by others on assigned/tracked tickets, which opens said ticket upon tapping the notification."

indication/OpenRedmine,open,Organize Subprojects inside Parent-projects / Sort projects alphabetically,[],"Hello. We have many projects in our company. We organize them as subprojects for each department.
We have a responsive template in our redmine, works well in smartphones.  But your app is great because of the offline sync, so the team can see the tasks even without internet.
However the lack of Parent/Sub-project (tree) view in the project page makes it really difficult to find information.

Another (and maybe easier to implement) important thing (even before parent/sub project view) is to sort projects alphabetically (like in redmine). This way we would at least be able to group related projects with a prefix in the name.
Keep up the great work, congratulations"
indication/OpenRedmine,closed,Add a Gitter chat badge to README.md,[],"### indication/OpenRedmine now has a Chat Room on Gitter

@indication has just created a chat room. You can visit it here: [https://gitter.im/OpenRedmine/Lobby](https://gitter.im/OpenRedmine/Lobby?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&content=body_link).
This pull-request adds this badge to your README.md:
If my aim is a little off, please [let me know](https://github.com/gitterHQ/readme-badger/issues).
PS: [Click here](https://gitter.im/settings/badger/opt-out) if you would prefer not to receive automatic pull-requests from Gitter in future.

indication/OpenRedmine,open,Cannot sync data with redmine server,[],I am trying to test the openredmine app with my redmine server. I can login from the app, and can see issues related to projects. But when I try to make some change (e.g. add a note/comment to an issue, try to change a status etc. ), it doesn't sync the changes to the server. The app only displays ""Has been saved to remote"". The data shown in the app remains the same. It seems its not able to post data to the server.
My server environment is as follows:
Is there any configuration on the server that needs to be enabled ?
I am logging in using HTTPS (basic auth). I enabled REST web service in the authentication settings on the server.
I tested my server with play store app RedminePM, and it can work fine with my server. The differences I observed were the following:
1. RedminePM uses JSON, while OpenRedmine uses XML
2. RedminePM attaches a key argument in the query string when making PUT requests. I didn't observe that with OpenRedmine"
indication/OpenRedmine,closed,Add filter,"[Label(name=""enhancement"")]","- Show closed date to issue detail
- Add issue filter to limit open or closed issues (#199)"
I use this a lot. One weak point is, that it can lead to endless lists where all are closed - except a few across the list; scrolling, scrolling...
Currently, from time-to-time I drop and re-create the server-settings to get a clean list. (loosing all cached data, of course )
Would be nice to have an option to ""hide"" or ""delete"" closed ones. ( or hide X days after close, .. )

indication/OpenRedmine,closed,Markdown Support,[Label(name=""enhancement"")]","I was trying out this app and I noticed the wiki styling information is completely missing inside the app. Our Redmine is set up for markdown support and this is not interpreted by OpenRedmine.
What's worse, newlines are not rendered as well making the text almost illegible.
Is there supposed to be support for basic wiki styling? How hard would it be to add?
I did a quick search on the code and there are some markdown and textile classes but I didn't look further into it.

indication/OpenRedmine,closed,Google Play Warning: SSL Error Handler Vulnerability,[Label(name=""bug"")]","Hello Google Play Developer,

Your app listed at the end of this email has an unsafe implementation of the WebViewClient.onReceivedSslError handler. Specifically, the implementation ignores all SSL certificate validation errors, making your app vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks. An attacker could change the affected WebView's content, read transmitted data (such as login credentials), and execute code inside the app using JavaScript.

Please address this vulnerability as soon as possible and increment the version number of the upgraded APK. To properly handle SSL certificate validation, change your code to invoke SslErrorHandler.proceed() whenever the certificate presented by the server meets your expectations, and invoke SslErrorHandler.cancel() otherwise. If you are using a 3rd party library that’s responsible for this, please notify the 3rd party and work with them to address the issue.

For more information about the SSL error handler, please see our documentation in the Android Developers Help Center. For other technical questions, you can post to Stack Overflow and use the tags “android-security” and “SslErrorHandler.”
To confirm you’ve upgraded correctly, submit the updated version to the Developer Console and check back after five hours. If the app hasn’t been upgraded correctly, we will display a warning.

While these specific issues may not affect every app that uses WebView SSL, it’s best to stay up to date on all security patches. Apps with vulnerabilities that expose users to risk of compromise may be considered Dangerous Products in violation of the Content Policy and section 4.4 of the Developer Distribution Agreement.

Apps must also comply with the Developer Distribution Agreement and Content Policy. If you feel we have sent this warning in error, contact our policy support team through the Google Play Developer Help Center.
Beta package is available on test site:

indication/OpenRedmine,open,Does not sync and show issues,[Label(name=""bug"")]","Hi,
I have two redmine installations and the app only works with one installation.
Some details about the problem instance:
- CAcert SSL certificate (root ca and class 3 ca are imported in android)
- it is running behind apache, but there are no requests caused by the app in access logs
- there are no errors displayed in the server logs
- the app don't display any errors
- I can sign in / request a token through the app
indication/OpenRedmine,open,Add functionality to add an image to Issues and Issue comments,[Label(name=""bug"")]","This idea comes from the use cases where I often encounter
- issues (crashes etc.) on hosts which are not in the infrastructure, or
- errors which are displayed only shortly, or
- errors which are not logable otherwise
I'd love to take a picture of those and simply create/update an issue and append the image. To my mind, this saves a lot of time...
